availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Fridolin "Fred" Brutsche (Newport, Kentucky, shopkeeper and distiller.)

body.p: Newport, Kentucky, shopkeeper and distiller. Native of Baden. Married to Margaret Ziegler Brutsche. Father of Rosana Brutsche, Theresa Brutsche Gaupel, Frederick Brutsche, Elizabeth Brutsche, Joseph Brutsche, Margaret Brutsche, Anna Brutsche, and Kate Brutsche. Tavern keeper in Newport, Kentucky, in 1860. Coffeehouse operator in Covington, Kentucky, in 1861. Resident in Covington in 1862. Distiller in Newport in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 525.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. X328B-329A.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 17, Campbell County, Kentucky, 1865, p. 58.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #18915.
Williams' Covington and Newport Directory, (Cincinnati: Williams & Co., 1899), 287
Williams' Covington Directory for 1861 (Cincinnati: Williams & Co., 1861), 460.
"Fridolin Brutsche (1814-1867)," Find A Grave, Memorial #92065707, accessed July 21, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/92065707.
